La traduzione italiana della versione ridotta delle regole di Tunnels & Trolls della 5a edizione, pubblicata su autorizzazione dell'editore Flying Buffalo, Inc. (FBI).

A much-abridged, authorized, no-art, Italian-language version of Tunnels & Trolls Rulebook (5th Edition).

boardgame.name: Ironsworn: Starforged
boardgame.description:
From the kickstarter:

The sci-fi evolution of the award-winning tabletop roleplaying game. Supports solo, co-op, and guided play!

From the introduction:

In Ironsworn: Starforged you are a spaceborne hero sworn to undertake perilous quests. You will explore uncharted space, unravel the secrets of a mysterious galaxy, and build bonds with those you meet in your travels. Most importantly, you will swear iron vows and see them fulfilled—no matter the cost.

boardgame.name: The Art of Boxing Clever: Solo Play AI Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
The Solo Play AI expansion for The Art of Boxing Clever allows you to pit your wits against three skill levels of AI boxers. Each of the five boxing styles are available to fight against in the form of the 5 boxers from the base game.

Expand your Art of Boxing Clever board game experience with Solo Play. Can you beat a bunch of cards?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Art of Boxing Clever: Arcade Mode Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
The Arcade mode for The Art of Boxing Clever offers an alternative experience for faster paced gameplay. Perfect for when you are short of time.

Time becomes a factor in your decision making and the original The Art of Boxing Clever damage system is streamlined to create a simplified boxer health bar indicator. All the tactical options are available to you from the original game, but if it's possible this is an even more intense version of the ART of BOXING CLEVER.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monster Clashhh!
몬스터 클래시
boardgame.description:
Monster Clashhh! is a fast and fun ROLL & FIGHT game. You have to be first friends with all 5 monsters! When you be a friends with monsters, attack another player! Also you have to keeping the most life points at the same time. Risk management, tactical choices and luck are the keys which will lead you to the victory.

Gameplay

1. Every player receives one summoner’s sheet.
2. Players play clockwise.
3. First player rolls the four dice, trying to get a combo allowing you to fill the spaces of Monster or the spaces of Special Ability. You can roll 3 times the dices (choosing the one(s) you wanna roll again).
4. When you decide to stop (usually after the 3rd roll), trigger the effect of your final combos according to the rules.
5. When you finish, the player at your left can play his turn (by rolling his dice and completing his summoner’s sheet).
6. The game is over when a player succeeds in summoning the five different monsters while having the most HP or if all of his opponents lose all of their HP.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Art of Boxing Clever: Fighting Dirty Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
The Fighting Dirty expansion for the ART of BOXING CLEVER has been designed to add extra spice to the base game by introducing the underhanded tactics and dark arts of fighting dirty in the boxing ring. The expansion offers players new tactics to gain the upper hand over their opponents and inflict maximum damage on their most vulnerable areas.

Sportsmanship is now a factor. Will your boxer be an instigator or a victim? New options are available for you to decide which approach suits your needs.

Last but by no means least, introducing your referee Mr Geoffrey Weller who be on the lookout for any illegal tactics. Boxer's will be warned, deducted points or even disqualified if spotted.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Vaction Spin
boardgame.description:
Travel to 8 Exotic destinations, with varying prices simulating the variables of real travel. Destinations such as Alaska, Costa Rica, Hawaii, Italy, Mexico, Tahiti.

Object of the game is to travel to as many Destinations within a set time. There are no dice and spinner offers varying prices. Player buys vouchers, for example 'Scuba diving in Tahiti 200 X Spin. If he spins 1, pay $200. If another player spins 8, pay $1,600 for the Same voucher!

This takes into consideration variables such as traveling High vs. low season, Deluxe vs. economy, Number in your party. This is what makes my game Unique, as there are no set prices in travel.

'Travel Ups and Downs' cards add fun surprises. Up: Dream vacation, go to any Destination. Down: Luggage went on its own vacation, Pay $1,500 to the Travel Bonus corner. Player who lands on this space gets all the loot!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pick Pic
boardgame.description:
Pick Pic is a game about picture associations and crazy funny photos.
You have to divide your photos so they fit the photos in front of each player as well as possible. If the other players recognize your photo as being placed there deliberately, both will score points. But they prefer a random photo to yours, none of you will get any points.

Gameplay

1. Reveal a card : every player draws a card and puts it face up in front of him.
2. Give cards : each player draws a few cards (regarding the number of players) and watches them secretly.
3. Each player has to look carefully at the face up cards of the other players, they must find a common feature between the cards they hold and the one which are in front of the players.
4. Once they finish finding a common feature, they have to give, face down, one card from their hand to every other player.
5. Rank cards : When all players have received exactly one card from each of the other players, they have to draw one random card from the deck and shuffle it into their stack of cards without revealing it.
6. Each player may look at the cards in front of him. They have to rank them face up, placing the card which has most in common with the first picture in first position, and so on.
7. Evaluate score : The players will score points regarding which rank are their cards.
8. End : The game ends when one or few players reach 20 points, if they don’t, they begin another round.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Circustar
boardgame.description:
Circustar is a perfect filler game for your game night. Each round, players receives 5 performance cards and players can score once per each performance during the game. So you have to manage your cards and choose which performance to score in each round to earn best score.
But be careful! Other players may mess up your plan.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Goons: The Junkyard Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Junkyard Expansion for Goons introduces a brand new Junkyard location to finally give players a chance to do something useful with all those annoying junk cubes laying around! Just snatch a junk cube, take it to the Junkyard and trade it for something useful! Just keep in mind that the Junkyard might want a little something in return...

The expansion also introduces 5 new Items to throw your money at. Get a hold of a super gnarly skateboard, badass nunchucks, a can of refreshing Knuckle Soda, gloves or a butterfly knife!

And of course, 4 more zany Villains with new Schemes presenting new risk, rewards and challenges! Will you throw your support behind Big Carls wacky wildlife shenanigans? Join Aztro’s psychedelic pattern based schemes, support Teresas explosive plans, or help The Void perform his uncanny rites?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Anno Domini 1666: Swords of Light and Darkness
boardgame.description:
Swords of Light and Darkness is an expansion to Anno Domini 1666, a swashbuckling board game of intrigue and mystery, set in alternative reality 17th century Vienna.

In the Swords of Light and Darkness players will try to convice Elector of Brandenburg Friedrich Wilhelm to vote for candidate supported by their political faction. It depends on you whether Louis XIV of France or Charles II of Spain called El Hechizado (The Bewitched) will become new emperor. In the shadow of the great politics we'll see duel between the two famous fencers: Salvatore Fabris, possessed by mighty demon Caarcinolaas and Gérard Thibault d'Anvers. Only few people realise that conseqences of duel between Sword of Light and Sword of Darkness could be much more serious than result of the imperial election...

boardgame.name: Bezzerwizzer Timeline
boardgame.description:
Bezzerwizzer Timeline combines the two games Bezzerwizzer and Timeline.

Each player/team gets 4 cards with a historical events, and has to place them at the correct place on the timeline - but if you're wrong, the other teams can get point by playing the Bezzerwizzer token!

By using the Zwap token, you can exchange two of the cards in play, so you get one of the opponent's cards and they get one of yours, or you can just swap between two opponents.

The longer you wait to place your cards, the more points they will yield - but it will also be more difficult, as there are more cards on the timeline.

boardgame.name: Am Ende des Regenbogens
boardgame.description:
In this environmental game, players try to prevent greenland from being covered with mud. In his turn, a player reveals a situation card that shows a positive or negative environmental behaviour. In the case of negative behaviour, the bad figure "Schmutzich" is moved towards a target field, in the case of positive behaviour, the good figure "Knud" may be moved towards the target field. In addition, the player rolls the dice and can move his own figure or "Knud" towards the target field. If "Schmutzich" reaches the target field first, mud is placed on grassland, if "Knud" and a player arrive before "Schmutzich", a rainbow piece is placed. The players win together if they manage to lay 4 rainbow pieces. The players lose if "Schmutzich" was able to lay 4 mud pieces.

—user summary

boardgame.name: バトルアスリート (Battle Athlete)
boardgame.description:
バトルアスリート (Battle Athlete) is a racing game from Japan. Players are athletes competing in a road race across mountains and valleys. But the course has obstacles and the players push each other around or use items to get the jump on the others. The first to the finish line is the winner.

The race course is made of large tiles placed in a line. The game has a starting tile, and five course tiles, of which four are used, and a finish line. The course tiles have a variety of icons; walls, pits, arrows and objects.

Players choose the turn order, and the last player puts their athlete where they like on the start line, then the next player and so on. In this way, the start player does not get an advantage.

Players roll dice and move their athlete. If they end up on an icon, or push another athlete onto one, the actions are completed.

Pits make a player fall back 2 places and miss a turn. Walls delay players, and arrows push them in the direction of the arrow. The ? icon lets the player draw an object card from the deck. These objects allow the player to make advances, or delay other players, or even change the position of the course tiles.

The first player to reach the finish line wins the race.

The designer Misaki notes that this was one of their earliest designs. It became the third game published by the doujin circle, but had been a car race game sent to a magazine five years previously. The prototype was made 15 years before 2009, making it 1994. The designer thought it was too good a game to waste and brought it back into production in 2009.
user summary

boardgame.name: Monastic Knights
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three unique character classes designed to fill the role between Clerics and Paladins in your favorite OSR roleplaying game campaign.

The monastic knights come in three general types:

Knights of Sanctity (Sanctifiers) are balanced between being warriors and healers.
Knights of Ardor (Ardents) are compassionate healers and only fight as necessary.
Knights of Vindication (Vindicators) are formidable warriors with a few spells.

Monastic Knights are designed to work with any OSR style RPG that is based on the original fantasy roleplaying game.

This PDF includes:

3 Monastic Knight Character Classes
A "White Box" addendum
Fully illustrated Character Sheets
Sample maps of Monasteries

boardgame.name: Mesopotamia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From here to there isn't always just a journey, sometimes it is the adventure itself. The party is headed for a job opportunity and all they have to do to get there is cross the Daunted Mountains and the Harbinger River...how tough could that be?

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, for a trio of PCs of third level.

boardgame.name: Biathlon
boardgame.description:
The players compete as biathletes. They move their pawns with a dice over a circuit with uphills and downhills. The dice are also rolled at the shooting range.
The player who crosses the finish line first wins the game.
Several rule additions, e.g. event cards, risk minimisation when shooting, increased risk of falling when moving downhill and the use of tactical action cards extend the basic game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Norse Grimoire
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Norse Grimoire is a 5th Edition supplement, designed to integrate Galdrastafir (Icelandic magical staves) and the Elder Futhark (the alphabet of the Runes of Knowledge) in your game sessions and campaigns.

This Grimoire is the follow-up to our work and research that started almost 20 years ago, which has given life to the Journey To Ragnarok project, our first Kickstarter campaign. With Norse Grimoire you can improve your Journey To Ragnarok sessions and setting, but you can also power up characters or worlds from any setting you like.

Our goal is to enhance both the Adventurers’ and the Players’ experience, adding game options and trying to transmit an ancient culture that we love.

To better understand Icelandic staves and the Runes, we decided to focus our research on ancient sources. Poetic and Prose Edda, along with Runic Poems, led our way on the path shaped by Odhinn in his journey through the Nine Worlds. For Icelandic symbols, we browsed through the pages of authentic grimoires filled with cryptic runes and staves, whose Norse echoes, sometimes bounded to continental magic, Middle Age esoteric or alchemical doctrine, unveiling a meaningful world permeated by magic.

boardgame.name: Voidfall
boardgame.description:
For centuries, the Novarchs, descendants of the royal House of Novarchon, have ruled with an iron fist over the feudalistic galactic empire of humankind, the Domineum. During this time, they brought stunning technological innovation and scientific advancements to their domain. This accelerated progression helped the Domineum reach — and eventually inhabit — even the farthest segments of the known galaxy, where new Houses emerged to govern the outer sectors of the empire. As the House of Novarchon grew in power, so grew the religious cult that surrounded them, proclaiming grim prophecies about an ancient cosmic being from another dimension: the Voidborn.

Many thought it to be only a myth, but in truth, it was the Voidborn's dark influence that granted the Novarchs the sheer knowledge to achieve rapid expansion for the empire. While the cult of the Novarchs envisaged eternal life through the otherworldly entity, the Voidborn's only intention was satiating its eternal hunger. And so, when the Domineum had achieved a vastness fitting the Voidborn's craving, interdimensional rifts opened at the heart of the Domineum to unleash cosmic corruption. As the House of Novarchon and its followers welcomed the Voidborn and sought their false salvation, the entity infected and spread and seized control over the inner worlds. Now, it is time for the remaining Great Houses to purge the galactic corruption, prevent the Voidborn from fully manifesting in our dimension, and to ultimately overcome the chaos as the new rulers of the Domineum.

Voidfall is a space 4X game that brings the genre to Euro enthusiasts' tables. It combines the tension, player interaction, and deep empire customization of the 4X genre with the resource management, tight decisions, and minimum-luck gameplay of an economic Euro. Win by pushing back the Voidborn in the solo/coop mode, or by overcoming your rivals' influence in restoring the Domineum in the competitive mode — both using the same rule set and game system. Variability is ensured not only by multiple playable houses with their own strengths and weaknesses, but also by many different map set-ups for all game modes.

As the leader of a defiant Great House, you play through three cycles, each with a game-altering galactic event, a new scoring condition, and a set number of focus cards that can be played. Focus card decisions and sequencing is the centerpiece of the gameplay. By selecting two of their three impactful actions as you play them, you develop and improve techs; advance on your three house-specific civilization tracks; manage your sectors' infrastructure, population, and production; and conquer new sectors with up to five different types of space fleets. Space battles are fought either against the Voidborn's infected forces (which are present as neutral opponents even in the competitive mode) or against other players. Instead of relying on the luck of a die roll, battles in Voidfall are fully deterministic and reward careful preparation and outsmarting your opponents.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Witches and the Wyrm
boardgame.description:

The snake will not die, and time does not turn properly. Three witches summon the Hero to do their bidding, and conquer the defiant serpent.

The Witches and the Wyrm is an epic adventure for one player and one GM.

boardgame.name: Downtime Destinations: Mama Bardousa's Bathhouse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Mama Bardousa's Bathhouse might be considered a high expense by some, but this luscious locale is not just a place of soap and water. It touches the divine with its beauty and art, enlivening and healing the body and spirit from the moment you enter. And let’s be honest, darling. I put my name on it, so it must be marvelous!”
- Mama Bardousa, mistrielle of Mama Bardousa’s Bathhouse

Carefully crafted and curated to be a feast for every sense, Mama Bardousa's Bathhouse is well known for the luxury and class that it allows its patrons to experience. No matter their background or standing in society, as long as adventurers have the coin and are willing to abide by the bathhouse’s code of conduct, they can experience any of the wonders that Mama Bardousa’s has to offer within its walls. And if they bring enough coin, they can experience a few hidden wonders outside of it as well.

This supplement includes:

Information on Mama Bardousa's Bathhouse and the wonders it holds—including a hideout for visitors who need to lay low and a portal to another plane!
The 3 NPCs that keep the bathhouse and its interests operational.
6 bath blend effects for your PCs to enjoy.
A table of 20 patrons to fill out the destination.
10 rumors to add intrigue to your stay.

boardgame.name: Magic, Technology, And Worldbuilding: 50 Questions For Creatives
boardgame.description:
Creating fictional worlds also means figuring out how people take control of their environment, be it magic or technology. Your characters are going to build houses, cast spells, use computers, brew potions. Magic and technology in many ways are the same thing for worldbuilding - but what do they mean for your setting?

This book is a helpful series of 50 questions, as well as follow-up exercises and more, to help you think about magic and technology in your setting. From economics to social standing, delivery to training, there's plenty of questions to get you to think. It's having a worldbuilding coach in one handy guide!

So it's time to talk about magic, technology, and the worlds you make!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Worldbuilding Checkup: 50 Questions For Creatives
boardgame.description:
Creating fictional worlds is complicated, and sometimes you need to step back and make sure you're doing it right. Other times, you want to prepare yourself before going forward. This book is to help you make sure you're keeping your worldbuilding on track!

This book is a helpful series of 50 questions, as well as follow-up exercises and more, to help you evaluate how well you're building your world. From timelines to rules, from audience expectation to genres, it's like having a coach at your fingertips!

Time for a worldbuilding checkup!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Characters And Worldbuilding: 50 Questions For Creatives
boardgame.description:
Characters are the way people experience your stories, games, and more - and they're unique expressions of your world. Making sure characters are part of your setting, bring people into their setting, and act believably is critical to good writing and worldbuilding.

This book is a helpful series of 50 questions, as well as follow-up exercises and more, to help you think about characters and setting. From goals and motivations to agency and history, this guide is here to help you think and explore!

Time to take a look at characters.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Errant Champion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new cause for the Pathfinder 2nd edition Champion!

Your cause is your own. As an errant champion, you are not charged with the divinity your cousin champions are granted to perform their oathbound duties. You have forsaken or given up such divine blessings and favors, instead seeking to harness your own determination and spirit in the face of adversity.

boardgame.name: Cult of Sobek
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mystery cults are secret societies that exist within religious institutions. Like other secret societies, their existence is well known, but their rituals, lore, and objectives are concealed. Only the initiated are allowed access to these secrets.

This file provides an overview of mystery cults and specific details about the Cult of Sobek, Egypt's greedy and ambitious crocodile deity.

Features:

Sample cult secrets
The location of Sobek's major temple and mortuary complex
The Feast of Sobek and other festivals held in his honor
A Giant Crocodile Mummy
A New Magic Item, Sobek's Helmets
A new spell, Day's Catch
The Oath of Taking

boardgame.name: Autonomía Zapatista
boardgame.description:
Zapatista Autonomy is a board game in which we collaborate to build autonomy in a Zapatista caracol. It was created by the European social movement in support of the Zapatistas, in order to support the Zapatista journey to Europe in 2021.

The goal of the game is to achieve the 13 Zapatista demands and the 7 principles of leading by obeying before the end of the tenth round of the game. In order to do this, you will have to cultivate the land, build houses and community infrastructure, train the promoters, fight against threats, etc.

The 13 Zapatista demands are:


Land
Democracy
Labor
Freedom
Food
Information
Housing
Culture
Health
Justice
Education
Peace
Independence


Each demand is achieved when the two required objectives, indicated on the back of the card, are met.

The 7 principles of leading by obeying are:


To serve others, not serve oneself.
To represent, not to supplant.
To build, not to destroy.
To obey, not to order.
To propose, not to impose.
To convince, not to defeat.
To work from below, not seek to rise.


Each principle is achieved by convening the Good Government Council.

Turn Sequence:
In each turn, these 3 phases are carried out:
1. Show context cards
2. Roll and place dice
3. Resolution of the turn

End of the Game:
If at the end of a round you have achieved the 13 Zapatista demands and the 7 principles of leading by obeying, you have won the game. If any demand or principle is still missing when you have completed 10 game rounds, you have lost the game.

boardgame.name: Life of a Chameleon
boardgame.description:
A chameleon’s life isn’t easy–constantly adapting to new environments and hiding from predators like snakes! It takes a lot of patience to sneak around and hunt bugs for food. No one truly appreciates the chameleon’s plight!

You are a chameleon just trying to make your way in this world, eating one bug at a time. Eat specific colors of bugs in the right order to win. Snatch tasty insects right out from under your opponents as you navigate the board fraught with dangerous snakes and other competitive chameleons.

Players take turns moving around the board to collect bugs of their same color. Throughout the game players roll to add more bugs to the board. As chameleons, players can change their own color in order to eat new bugs and pass safely by snakes of the same hue. The game includes 21 colored chameleon meeples for this very purpose.

As players start and complete objective cards they collect achievement cards which can help with additional actions or alternative ways to score. Whenever an objective is completed, the active player rolls a die and moves a progress marker along the game track. When the marker reaches the end, the game is over and all players tally their scores.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Trypsylon
boardgame.description:
The game is in the tradition of the abstract connecting games like Hex and consists of 36 identical tiles showing a route in the shape of a "Y". At the beginning, all tiles are arranged face down forming a large square. On your turn, pick a face down tile and push it from the border into the square with the Y face up.
The player who first has a complete route from his side to the opposite side wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Limbo
boardgame.description:
Arithmetic game with a traditional card deck, from David Parlett, creator of Ninety-Nine. From a hand of 5, players play a card at a time, either deducting from or dividing into the current sum. Totals start at 101 each hand and go down to as close to 0 as possible. The catch is: If card played divides into the sum without remainder then it may not be deducted but must divide. (For instance a 5 played to 20 must divide for 4 rather than deduct for 15, whereas a 3 must deduct since it can't divide into 20 evenly.)

An Ace counts either 1 or 11. A Jack played repeats the same value as the previous card. A Queen reverses the digits of the current count. However, you may only play a Queen if reversing the digits reduces the count. A King divides by any desired number higher than 1 and lower than the current, provided that it leaves no remainder.

The hand ends when one player plays their last card or is unable to play without going below zero.

boardgame.name: Fighters & Warlords - Fantasy Add-On
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Just like magic, martial prowess plays a big part in any fantasy setting. From ferocious axe-wielding fighters and cunning rapier-wielding swashbucklers to short sneaky sling masters and alert crossbowmen firing from afar, fantasy settings harbor many fighter archetypes.

boardgame.name: Galagan's Island: Reprymian Rising
boardgame.description:
Galagan's Island is an Arcade style Space Shooter, paying loving homage to classic arcade style and difficulty.

Currently featuring 25 LEVELS of handcrafted whimsical charm.
The formations are so pretty, you almost don't want to destroy them. LOL!

Galagan's Island utilizes dynamic scaling of ship abilities. As you progress through the game YOUR ability to perform improves as well.

Source: Steam.

boardgame.name: Immanence
boardgame.description:
Immanence is a game for one to five players about the passengers of a colony ship that has left Earth in the year 3020 in pursuit of a new home. Each player controls a human passenger of said ship as they’re awoken from stasis sleep. The game is primarily driven by the interactions and emotions exchanged between multiple players or the reflections of a single player.

The purpose of Immanence is to explore our individual and collective relationships with Earth, each other, ourselves, and the greater Universe.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: In Space, No One Can Hear You Feel
boardgame.description:
In Space, No One Can Hear You Feel

You’ve both been on a ship for an untold amount of time and have just woken from cryo-sleep.
The ship is broken and beyond repair.
Lights don’t always work. Power is low.
The oxygen supply already feels thin. Supplies are almost non-existent.

Help is not coming.
Together you face the darkness.

These are your last moments.

This is a GMless game that uses 1d6 and a partner to play.

Source: The Developer Website.
boardgame.rpg: In Space, No One Can Hear You Feel

boardgame.name: აღმოაჩინე საქართველო (Discover Georgia)
boardgame.description:
აღმოაჩინე საქართველო , Discover Georgia

Players have to travel to different parts of Georgia and visit different cities

Each turn players draw cards and attempt to claim routes to achieve their objective (cards).
The objective cards indicate destinations between cities in Georgia and bordering countries.
Player scores points by claiming routes (the longer the more points) and achieving their objective (the further away, the more points scored at end of game).

The goal is to visit as many places as possible to earn more points. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Tiles I
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Warlock clips allow players to construct rooms in advance and place them on the table as needed.
This set includes:

26x – 2”x2” Dual-Sided Tiles
2x – 4”x4” Dual-Sided Tiles
2x – 2”x8” Dual-Sided Tiles
18x – 2” Straight Stone Walls

boardgame.description:

Experience a perfect, Continuous grid through the entire play space with our patented, modular, ultra-slim interior walls
This set includes:

24x – (2”x2”) WarLock Tiles
4x – Plaster Walls, 2”
4x – Plaster Walls, with Half Window, 2”
4x – Plaster Walls, with Cracked Wall, 2”

5x – Plaster Walls Outside Corner

8x – OpenLOCK Clips

boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

With Stairs & Ladders, you’ll have everything you need for a multi-floored scenario. Mix and match with other WarLock Tiles for even larger adventure setups.
This set includes:

2x – Staircase to Landing (Stone)
2x – Staircase to Landing (Wood)
2x – Elevated Staircase from Landing (Stone)
2x – Elevated Staircase from Landing (Wood)

2x – Elevated Staircase (Stone)
2x – Wooden Ladder
2x – Large Ladder

boardgame.name: Dungeon Dressings
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Dungeon Dressings provides a variety of options for creating unique and immersive dungeons for your players to experience.
This set includes:

This Set Includes:*


4x – Chairs
2x – Round Tables
3x – Crates

boardgame.name: Expansion Pack I
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

WarLock Tiles: Expansion Box I adds more of the essentials to build out your gameplay environment. More walls, clips, doors, and pillars to build more complex dungeons and scenarios. Fully compatible with all other WarLock Tile products.

boardgame.name: Doors & Archways
boardgame.description:
Expand your scene with new door types
Adds exciting play experiences with things like prison Cells and hidden doors
100% compatible with Warlock floor tiles, pre-painted
Extraordinary definition, expansive variety of items to add to your scenes
Fantastic value, works with existing WizKids products

boardgame.name: Summoning Circles
boardgame.description:
Led included! Light-up base features multiple colors
Create cool magical effects in your games for traps or other spells
100% compatible with Warlock floor tiles
Pre-painted, extraordinary definition
Expansive variety of items to add to your scenes

boardgame.name: Tech Company
boardgame.description:
This game puts you behind the wheel of one of the most important tech companies in the last century. You will relive the stories of some of the most influential technology innovators in history that paved the way to what we are capable of today. People like Edwin H. Land, a scientist who invented a whole new paradigm in photography with Polaroid, or Nolan Bushnell who executed on the first ever video gaming ideas with Atari, that drove the world into an age of digital video games and personal computers. It will be like being inside an interactive documentary, where you play the founder first person.

You start as a simple tech start-up and through multiple plays you and the story evolve into giving you the responsibility of turning your first product successes into a real tech company that people worship. A company that aims to take over the world with cutting edge inventions by visionary and quirky personalities.

You will attract the best talent, develop prototypes and turn them into mind boggling customer experiences. You will need to compose a sweet spot of skills in product design and engineering, business, management, marketing, and people. Talent with certain know-how can help you create better quality products. But to make all that happen you need investors and business-savvy individuals who can open the doors you need to succeed in a competitive consumer space of other tech companies - your opponents who you meet over beers at conferences and in courtroom disputes over patent infringement.

Through a new and profound way of pairing a board game with an app on your phone, the initial barrier of getting past a complex set of rules is replaced by a progressive approach that teaches you the game through a simple first start-up story. Then it grows more and more complex over the course of multiple play sessions towards transforming you into becoming a massive tech giant in the end.

The app will also be used to communicate the narrative through audio storytelling, to communicate every mechanic’s tie-in to the theme and context, to manage gaming sessions in this new narrative format, where you can save your progress between play sessions, and to be a rules learning or reminder companion, to get you quickly back into the game, if you have had a break from it.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Milk inside a bag of milk inside a bag of milk
boardgame.description: Steam description - A short story about what sort of challenges everyday little things can be. Help the girl buy milk, be the first not to disappoint her.

boardgame.name: Urban Cards
boardgame.description: Steam description - Urban Cards is a cutthroat capitalist deckbuilder where cash is king. Make money to stay alive, build businesses, hire workaholic employees, and unscrupulous robbers to steal from the competition. Create your unique deck of colorful cards and amass a fortune to win!

boardgame.name: Puddle Knights
boardgame.description: Steam description - Protecting nobles from mud may look simple on the surface, but the intricate cape arranging puzzle mechanics ensure steadily increasing difficulty. Join the Knights on their quest to preserve dignity, and mindmuck is practically guaranteed! Playtime 10-35h.

boardgame.name: Vilket hundkaos
boardgame.description: One hundred dogs are on the run and you want to gather as many as possible in your kennel. Why is the dog's nose cold? Yes, answer that and other fun questions about dogs. Luck with the dice and good memory means that you can paw forward with Anders Bagge on the wonderfully mischievous playing field. A fun and varied game that is filled to the brim with dogs.

boardgame.name: Word Colony
boardgame.description:
An exciting common knowledge & word game for smart people.

Choose the correct answer to the general culture questions;
Collect Letter Cards
Build Word Colonies using the Letter Cards
Collect 40, 70 or 100 Points (it depends on the type of game chosen) & Win!


Discover new things about the world around you in an interactive way, with your group of friends or family!

The game can be played by 2 to 4 people, and the playing time varies depending on the type of game chosen (between 30 minutes and 3 hours). Have fun by getting smarter!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: よせがき教科書 (Yosegaki Kyokasho)
らくがき教科書 (Rakugaki Kyokasho)
boardgame.description:
This is two games in one package; らくがき教科書 (Rakugaki Kyokasho) and よせがき教科書 (Yosegaki Kyokasho). Rakugaki means graffiti, Kyokasho is a textbook for children. The second game Yosegaki Kyokasho means Write Jointly Textbook.

The game is from Japan and is home-made. Packaged in a large pencil case, the components include large plastic sleeves with paper inside, wipeable marker pens, and a variety of small cut-outs of portraits and images of various kinds. These might be from famous Western artworks, such as the Mona Lisa or Venus, or famous people such as Beethoven or Napoleon, or animals or objects. Likewise there are popular Japanese characters such as writers, samurai or politicians (including Admiral Perry!), or figures from ukiyo-e scrolls.

The idea of the game is to mimic writing graffiti in your school textbooks. Players put the cut-outs inside the wallets, backed with the white paper. They then use the markers to write their jokes and graffiti on the outside of the wallet, as if writing on the schoolbook. Then players compare their jokes and the funniest is given points. Most points wins.

The designer says "Let's draw a bikini on Sakamoto Ryōma!" (famous samuari and democrat).

The alternate game has players taking turns to choose a theme, such as 'alternate hairstyles', and players draw images to that theme in the same way. This is for players who are not used to making up rude jokes.
user summary

boardgame.name: Keyforge Adventures: Rise of the Keyraken
키포지 어드벤처: 키라켄의 습격
키포지 어드벤처: 키라켄의 습격
boardgame.description:
A preeminent Logos organization, the Society of Logic and Reason, has lost contact with one of its undersea observatories. In anticipation of trouble, they have hired a group of Archons to join the crew of their ship, the SLRS Vortexilon, and investigate. And it’s a good thing, too—the observatory has been destroyed by a beast from ancient mythology, and an Aquan cult is behind it!

Fantasy Flight Games is proud to announce that cooperative play is coming to KeyForge in two free-to-play adventures that expand upon the themes and mechanics found in Dark Tidings.

These two exciting adventures present players with a new challenge to overcome using the KeyForge decks in their collection. With each adventure playing in a unique way and featuring multiple difficulty levels, you must come up with entirely new strategies to win. Whether you are playing by yourself or with up to two friends, these adventures will take you to the depths of the Crucible’s oceans and face-to-face with epic monsters and cunning cultists.

boardgame.name: Erzähl mir was vom Bauernhof
boardgame.description: There's always something going on at the farm: cows, horses, pigs, rabbits and chickens run around happily and the tractor chugs across the yard. There is a lot to discover and name, which expands vocabulary and trains perception. The cute figures invite free play and the first rule game. Who finds the right place for his animal?

boardgame.name: Vault of the Void
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




The game is still in active development, but a version of it has been made available to the public for purchase - Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




Descend into the nightmare that is the Vault of the Void. Collect cards to modify your deck as you go so you can adapt to the challenges you'll face. A new single player card game that allows you to customise your deck and cards as you progress through each run. Use Void Stones to unleash modified cards of your creation to defeat the insidious minions that stand between you and The Void.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Snow Island
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A short run and gun game mini-game.

Developed by Taeyeon.

boardgame.name: I Have A Vision
boardgame.description:
You have been plagued by indecipherable dreams lately. They leave you with an overwhelming urge. An urge to build a wonderful, monstrous towering structure...

I Have A Vision is a 2-5 player game about a singular person's drive to make something with an inexplicable purpose. It is based off of the song Man-Made Object by Lemon Demon from the album Spirit Phone.

Made for the Neilvember Jam.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Goat Yoga Party Game
boardgame.description:
In this hilarious party game, players perform real yoga poses while completing ridiculous challenges with an inflatable goat. From balancing the goat on your head to batting it in the air, to bleating the tune to a song...your game night is sure to be filled with positive vibes and laugh-out-loud fun! Show us your moves! Share your pics and tag #GoatYogaPartyGame!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Schweizer Trachten-Spiel
boardgame.description: The players move by dice over a circuit to collect cards with Swiss costumes cards. The goal is to get sets of 4 cards from as many neighboring cantons as possible to get many extra points. Event cards and fields that lead to card loss are also present. The game ends when all costume cards have been distributed. The player with the most valuable sets wins.

boardgame.name: Hyex: In the name of science
boardgame.description:
Better keep your hands off this game if you don't want to get your hands dirty! If you are brave enough to involve in this experiment and willing to mercilessly sacrifice your creations in the name of science, you will become the scientist in a laboratory and hybridize and harvest your living samples. Care about your species and slaughter them at the right time to gain more points than your opponent. Be careful to avoid getting the experiment out of control.

Players take turns to spawn and hybridize the samples and harvest them at the right time to gain more victory points which are necessary to win. Each turn chose from following actions and after reaching 12 points game ends.

(at first is increased age of each living sample)


Draw a sample – draw a card
Harvest one living sample – gaining points from placed cards and discarding
Hybridize two samples (attempt with dice rolling) – possibility of placing of 2 cards as one sample, combination of both cards gives the sample unique ability - the most important for gaining victory points
Spawn one ordinary sample (also after unsuccessful hybridizing) – placing one ordinary sample (one card) which provides low amount of points
Play an alternative action (also after unsuccessful hybridizing) – play action shown along left side of the card


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Antiquity of Mars
boardgame.description:
Billions of years ago…
Mars was a flourishing planet teaming with life and vast seas. As the magnetic field over Mars weakened, radiation began to dry up the seas and solar winds caused the atmosphere to deplete. This in turn reduced the planet’s ability to maintain heat. After centuries of research, Mars’ leading scientists have developed a way to slow the depletion of oxygen and the cooling of the planet; however, it’s too little and far too late. It’s only a matter of time before the planet becomes completely uninhabitable. In this harsh environment, the few remaining races of Mars dangle from their last thread of existence.

Overview
Each player will represent a leader of one of the remaining races of ancient Mars. They will struggle to maintain the morale of their populace, while helping to keep the planet survivable for as long as possible. Players will also need to maintain control of lands to provide food, water and other resources—a task which may require force. Players will take turns placing multi-use cards on action spaces. The action space chosen will determine which part of the player’s card is activated (political, civil, or military). As the game progresses, players will expand their influence to gain more powerful actions, develop technologies to help combat the planet’s condition, gather resources to help keep their populace happy, and train armies to maintain their lands and resources. Each race is equipped with a unique ability allowing for various approaches to victory.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Antiquity of Mars: Chronicles of a Dying Planet

boardgame.name: La Cible
boardgame.description:
Inspired by a French television show. The game is composed of series of questions of increasing difficulty: "the first round", "the definitions", "the continuation", "the auctions" and "the final".

No answers are provided in the game.

boardgame.name: Stargrave: Dead or Alive – Bounty Hunting Solo Scenario Generator
boardgame.description:
Stargrave: Dead or Alive, a free supplement that gives you the tools to create and run specific solo adventures for Stargrave: Science Fiction Wargames in the Ravaged Galaxy! With this booklet, your independent crew can travel the galaxy, hunting for
outlaws and criminals with prices on their heads. Your crew might want to see justice done, have a personal score to settle, or maybe they are just in it for the money. Whatever the reason, they will face some tough fights against a rogues’ gallery of unique desperadoes.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Stargrave: Science Fiction Wargames in the Ravaged Galaxy

boardgame.name: TBH: NSFW Expansion
boardgame.description:
168 unique adult-themed dilemma cards for use with TBH: The Game of Honest Answers to Outrageous Questions.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: TBH: The Game of Honest Answers to Outrageous Questions

boardgame.name: Mythic Magazine (Volume 5 - Apr 2021)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Content:

What If: Combining Mythic With The Adventure Crafter
Variations: Generating Dark Woods And Wild Places
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Combining Mythic With The Adventure Crafter
Generating Dark Woods And Wild Places

boardgame.name: Recon Rescue
boardgame.description:
A special forces recon unit was a on secret mission when their helicopter crashed in the middle of the Vietnam jungle. The unit survived but not the pilot. With the mission scrubbed you have to make to back to the extraction zone and back to safety before the enemy tracks you down and captures you.

Your unit is trying to get to the extraction zone and they are being tracked by the enemy. Each turn your unit and the enemy randomly draw a number of colored d6 in specific order and place them on the player and enemy cards. Depending on the color of the die drawn, will determine any extra bonuses you or the enemy receive. Your squad must defeat the enemies dice to move to the next jungle terrain card. Each move you make can add or delete to your supplies "dice". It is a race to see who can get to the extraction zone first. If the enemy reaches the EZ first, your unit is captured. If the unit reaches the EZ first, you win. Your unit has special abilities that can be used one per game so be careful when using them.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Go to Hell
Höllfahren
Otrogna grannar
Unfaithful neighbours
boardgame.description:
The board was used for moving pieces while the players played cards. Depending on where you landed, different rules applied. For example, you had to be quiet or address someone in a specific way. If you failed to follow the rules, you moved a step closer to the centre, where people were being cooked in a pot. If you ended up there, you lost. The last player left was the winner and took all the money.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dark Veil Quickplay
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher Blurb

Dark Veil is a TTRPG (tabletop role-playing game) that centers on a diverse universe splintered in time, cohesively connecting eras of medieval fantasy, Victorian steam and steel, cyberpunk, and the infinite realms of the Veil. With role-play at its core, Dark Veil offers a simple success-based skill system that is quick and approachable for the modern geek enthusiast.

This book includes a brief description of the universe setting, rules to play, skills and their uses, storyteller tips, custom enemy generation tips for additional encounters, and pre-made characters. Storytellers should also download the preview starter adventure.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Panzer III J Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Pz.Kpfw. III Ausf. J (lets just call this a Panzer III J for simplicity) looks like the poor cousin of the Panzer IV H but the reality is quite different. With a mobility of 3 and initiative of 8 it is similar to the Cromwell or T-34, but lacks the armour so only has a survivability of 0. Of course this means it is the cheapest ‘fast’ tank you are going to find this side of Prokhorkvka. Looking for more initiative or firepower you can always upgrade the gun to the 3.7cm KW.K 36 L/46.5 or 5cm KW.K 39 L/60 respectively, or add a driver with Preventative Maintenance to let you modify a defensive hit to a critical to keep the tank in the fight a little longer.

Inside the Pz.Kpfw. III Ausf. J Expansion Pack, you will find a highly detailed, assembled, pre-primed plastic Pz.Kpfw. III Ausf. J tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalised to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M10 Wolverine Expansion
boardgame.description:
The M10 Wolverine is your typical tank destroyer, a glass cannon! It packs plenty of punch but if you concentrate your fire you can break it quickly. It has a solid firepower stat, which can be upgraded by replacing the 3” gun that comes as standard with the 76mm AT Gun M1A2 that improves both its firepower and initiative. Pair it up with lower initiative tanks that can shield it from enemy fire and a radio operator with Signal Boosting to improve the initiative of every other tank in your platoon.

Inside the M10 Wolverine Expansion Pack, you will find a highly detailed, assembled, pre-primed plastic M10 Wolverine tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalised to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Sherman Firefly Expansion
boardgame.description:
This tank acts like a tank destroyer with a massive Firepower 6 stat, but benefits from the medium tank rule that allows it to re-roll a blank attack dice! Use the included Heavy (APCR) Shell ammo upgrade to get even more bang for your buck (or points) or the crew card Concealment to buff your defense if you are planning on lurking in cover.

Inside the Sherman VC Firefly Expansion Pack, you will find a highly detailed, assembled, pre-primed plastic Sherman VC Firefly tank miniature and tank card. Your tank can be further personalised to match your requirements using the five crew, module, and upgrade cards included.

boardgame.name: Escape Room: Das Spiel – Puzzle Abenteuer: Secret of The Scientist
Escape Room: Dobrodružné puzzle – Tajemství vědy
Escape Room: Il Gioco – Puzzle Adventures: Il segreto della scienziata
Escape Room: The Game – Puzzle Adventures: Secret of The Scientist
Escape Room: The Game – Rompecabezas: El misterio de la científica
이스케이프 룸: 퍼즐 어드벤처 – 과학자의 비밀
boardgame.description:
In a mansion at the edge of town, a security alarm is blaring. As the rookie police officer, you've been assigned to investigate. Inside the mansion, you discover the body of a murdered woman and another shocking fact: the front door—and all other doors—cannot be opened from the inside. You are locked inside this obscure mansion with a corpse and no door handles... Your only way out is to escape. In this Escape Room-meets-jigsaw puzzle board game, you must solve the riddles in order to earn new puzzle pieces and unlock new rooms. It's your only way to exit the game and survive.

In this Escape Room-meets-jigsaw puzzle board game, you must solve the riddles in order to earn new puzzle pieces and unlock new rooms. It's your only way to exit the game and survive.

Thanks to the packaging's clever advent calendar design, you solve one large puzzle—the mansion—by completing 5 separate puzzles (the rooms). Read the story and solve the riddles in order to earn your puzzle pieces—and your eventual escape!

Play with or without time pressure. Feel like being put to the ultimate test? Set a time limit for your escape. If you prefer to pace yourself, forgo the clock and take your time to discuss the mystery and solve the puzzle.

Housed in an advent calendar-like design, the box includes all components for game play: riddles, puzzle pieces (1 large house which is made up of 5 smaller puzzles) & a puzzle-style decoder to check your answers.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Tiles II
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The newest additions to the highly anticipated WarLock™ Dungeon Tiles line from WizKids are finally available for release! After a year of R&D, Wizkids has perfected the dungeon tile. The WarLock™ Dungeon Tile system solves many of the problems presented with other tile systems. The WarLock™ clips allow players to construct rooms in advance and place them on the table as needed.

Full height 2” tall walls are perfect for players that want a deeper immersion into their game play. Offset walls provide you with the ability to place figures in any square on the grid, without pesky corners eating into your play area.

Experience a perfect, continuous grid through the entire play space with our patented, modular, ultra-slim interior walls. Additionally, all tiles are reversible with wood design on one side and stone on the other for double the functionality! We’ve also included adaptor clips for two of the most popular clip-based tile systems, DRAGONLOCK™ and OpenLOCK™, to help players integrate these tiles into their collection.

Key Features:

Modular
High Utility (Double-Sided)
Extraordinary Definition
Fantastic Value
FLGS Release (No KickStarter)
Works With Existing WizKids Products

This set includes:*


4x – 2” Stone Full Height Exterior Double Doors
4x – 2” Stone Full Height Exterior Single Doors
10x – 2” Stone Full Height Straight Walls with Accessory Port
10x – 2” Stone Full Height Interior Walls
4x - 2” Stone Full Height Interior Single Doors
8x - Full Height Stone Corner Pillars
5x - Stone Full Height Inside Corner Walls
5x - Stone Full Height Outside Corner Walls
2x - 4”x 4” Stone/Wood Dual-Sided Tiles
20x - 2”x2” Stone/Wood Dual-Sided Tiles
2x - 2”x 8” Stone/Wood Dual-Sided Tiles
16x - Stone Edge Caps
90x - WarLock Clips
8x - DRAGONLOCK™ Adaptor Clips
8x - OpenLOCK™ Adaptor Clips
4x - Torches
4x - Banners

boardgame.name: Quadragon
boardgame.description:
Quadragon is a card-driven strategy game in which players build an army of dragons and dragon-riding wizards in order to steal their opponent's treasure and protect their own.

Each card in Quadragon uses both sides of the card, and both sides are split in two, meaning that each card can be used in 4 different ways. One side contains a dragon and treasure, the other a wizard and spell. Dragons are used to attack your opponent's treasure and defend your own. Treasure is used to pay for wizards. Wizards can also steal treasure directly, or ride similarly-colored dragons for even more points. Spells can be cast by wizards to directly manipulate the battlefield, for example rotating or flipping cards, or scoring points. Each side of a card can only be used if the text is facing you, and all cards rotate after use. For example after attacking with a dragon it rotates to reveal its treasure, which makes it vulnerable to attack.

It is always a thrill to chain together a sequence of spells to flip and rotate cards, culminating in a massive points-scoring attack. The first player to reach 50 points wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Guiscard 2: La Garde varangienne
Guiscard 2: The Varangian Guard
boardgame.description:
GUISCARD 2 simulates the epic conquest of Southern Italy and Sicily be the Normans, led by Robert Guiscard ("the cunning" or "the weasel"), in the eleventh century. The game features the various factions of the time as the Byzantines, the Arabs of Sicily, the Lombards, the Germans and the Normans of course, who came as mere mercenaries in the middle of this mess of conflicting interests and who decided to seize power by arms.
GUISCARD 2 is intended for those who want to play Cry Havoc but can no longer get an original box.

GUISCARD was originally released in 2013 and is now out of print. This new version includes all the materials of the original game, but with counters printed on much thicker boards, a new map, new additional counters and a campaign game. New scenarios feature the Varangian Guard of the Byzantine emperors.

An upgrade kit for owners of the first version of GUISCARD is also available. This kit consists of:

- (5) A4 counter sheets printed on thick cardboard (similar to those of AGER SANGUINIS and MONTGISARD).
- The map of The Chapel
- The 2 campaign maps (Sicily and Apulia).
- The completely revised rulebook, with many clarifications. It is the most comprehensive version to date of the games in the Norman Saga series.
- The booklet with the historical background and the scenarios: 14 tactical scenarios including 4 entirely new ones and featuring the Varangian Guard of the Byzantine emperors, as well as 4 campaign scenarios.
- The 3 double-sided play sheets.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Hungry Knight
boardgame.description:
The theme of this jam was 10 Seconds. So we present to you Hungry Knight, a determined little adventurer with a big appetite. Fight your way through a strange wasteland, keep yourself fed every ten seconds, and accomplish a miracle. Others may perish at your hand, but such is the remorselessness of this world.

A challenging action game. It's hard, but you can do it! Be brave.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Out Of Shapes
boardgame.description: A dice game with shapes instead of numbers. You must collect each shape, but only once, if you roll a shape you have alreay collected, all the dice left, add together for points. As soon as a player reaches 15 points, the player with the lowest score wins.

boardgame.name: Trust Me, I'm a Superhero!: Silly Expansion
boardgame.description:
You've taken out the trash, and your city is safe again... Or is it? A range of sillier options for family friendly fun is available.

This expansion adds 20 more Powers and 20 more Supers to the game that can be mixed in to add a little silliness and wacky combos to the game.

There are no changes to the rules with this expansion, just mix in, play and laugh yourself silly!

boardgame.name: Trust Me, I'm a Superhero: NSFW Expansion
boardgame.description:
You've beaten back the baddies, and your city is safe again... Or is it? A range of naughtier options for adult fun is available.

This expansion adds 20 more Powers and 20 more Supers to the game that can be mixed in to add a HUGE... selection of adult combos to the game.

There are no changes to the rules with this expansion, just mix in, play and try not to get yourself too.. worked... up...

boardgame.name: Rally Point Volume 18: The French Army – Friend and Foe
boardgame.description:
Rally Point Volume 18: The French Army Friend and Foe is a set of 10 all new scenarios featuring the French Army World War II. Each scenario was handmade and play-tested to the high standard players expect from the Tampa ASL Group’s fine craftsmen. Each scenario is presented in the Schwerpunkt easy-to-read format on high-quality card stock.

RPT171 Pentecost Sunday Meeting – West of HANNUT, Belgium, 12 May 1940: Elements of the 12e Cuirassiers, 3e Division Légère Mécanique are conducting a screen with three AMD 35 armored cars and a platoon of sidecar equipped infantry when they are attacked by two platoons of motorcycle infantry from Aufklärungs Abteilung 7 and Pz IB, PzIIA and PZIIF tanks from the Panzer Division 4. This meeting of two reconnaissance units features lots of exciting maneuver for both sides and is an exciting, 5.5 turn tournament action set on boards 11a and 12a.

RPT172 L’embuscade du Geneste – CREHAN, Belgium, 12 May 1940: In this 5.5 turn scenario set on boards 9b, 11a and 85, a company of German infantry supported by nine tanks (including PzIBs, PzIIAs and PzIIIFs) is attacking to clear the village of Crehan when they run into an anti-armor ambush. The French, defending with seven H39 tanks and ten squads make this an action-packed, instant classic.

RPT173 Opportunité Fugace – MONTCORNET, France, 17 May 1940: The French 4 e Bataillon de Chasseurs Portés and 2e Compagnie, 46e Bataillon de Chars de Combat, 4e Division Cuirassée is attacking with seventeen squads, two D2(L) tanks and eight (yes 8) Char B1 bis tanks to the clear some buildings defended by eleven squads of the Pioneer Bataillon 37, Panzer Division 1 and knock out their three FlaK18 88mm guns. With ten tanks on a wide attack frontage, a battery of 88s, a flamethrower and DCs, there will be lots of movement and intense action in this medium sized, 6.5 turn scenario set on boards 11, 12b and 78. It is sure to become a classic.

RPT174 Ejected From Eloi – MONT ST. ELOI, France, 22 May 1940: The 1 ère Division Légère Mécanique is attacking with three S35 tanks and ten squads (including some truckmounted infantry) to clear the village of St Eloi of Battailon 1, Schutzen-Regiment 14, 5th Panzer Division 5’s seven German squads and a 37mm anti-tank gun. This is fast-playing 4.5 turn, tournament action set on boards 19 and 57 was designed by Brook White.

RPT175 Tardiveau Le Volontaire – HERLEVILLE, France, 5 June 1940: A company of German infantry from Infanterie Regiment 104, Infanterie Division 33 is preparing to launch an attack from a board 5 gully against 41e Régiment d’ Infanterie, 19e Division d’ Infanterie defending the board 70 village. Just as the Germans were about to begin their attack, the French launch a preemptive attack of their own with twelve squads and two Lorraine 38L personnel carriers from Detachment Tardiveau. This 5-turn tournament scenario has lots of exciting action.

RPT176 The Weygand Line – ST. FUSCIEN, France, 5 June 1940: Elements of German Infanterie Division 9 and Panzer Division 10 are attacking with eighteen squads to clear the French from town on the board 60 ridge. The 56ème Régiment, 16ème Division d’Infanterie is defending the town with twelve squads, heavily equipped with machine guns and supported by 80mm off-board artillery. This 6.5 turn, medium-sized, all infantry action also uses boards 9b and 11b.

RPT177 Tirailleurs and Antiques - MANICAMP, France, 5 June 1940: A German infantry company of fifteen squads from Infanterie Regiment 124, Infanterie Division 72 is attacking to clear the French from the wooden buildings of board 71’s village. Here, nine squads of the 18e Régiment Tirailleurs Algériens, 87e Division d’ Infanterie Afrique are defending with the help of three World War One vintage FT-17 tanks from 36e Bataillon de Chars de Combat. This 5.5 turn scenario was designed by Evan Sherry and also uses board 72.

RPT178 The Joffre Line – South of ANTSIRANE, Madagascar, 6 May 1942: The British 1 st Battalion Royal Scots Fusiliers, 2nd Battalion East Lancashire Regiment and 455 Light Battery (with seventeen squads, 94mm guns, carriers and Valentine/Tetrarch tanks) are attacking in three groups to seize control of buildings from the Vichy French 1st Battalion (Senegalese) and 2 nd Battalion (Malagache), 2nd Regiment, Fortress Diego Suarez’s eleven squads and four 75mm artillery pieces that are defending from trenches and a pillbox on boards x, 69 and 78. Can they hold out long enough for their World War I vintage FT17 tanks to save the day? Mike Augustine designed this large, but fast-playing 5 turn scenario.

RPT179 Operation Terminal – PORT OF ALGIERS, ALGERIA, 8 November 1942: The American 3rd Battalion, 135th Infantry Regiment, 34th Infantry Division with twelve squads have gone on the defensive in the face of a spirited Vichy French counter-attack by elements of 13ème Régiment de Tirailleurs Sénégalais with fourteen squads and six (yes 6) FT17 tanks. Mike Augustine designed this medium-sized, 5 turn scenario that uses boards 20, 23 and 49.

RPT180 Rapidement Vaincu – DOMPAIRE, France, 13 September 1944: Elements of the Free French 2 ème Division Blindée are attacking with four Sherman tanks, an M-10 tank destroyer and both dismounted and halftrack-mounted infantry to clear elements of Panzergrenadier Regiment 2112 and Panzer Abteilung 2112, Panzer Brigade 112 (with inexperienced tank crews) from their defensive positions in the town on boards 68 and 71. This is a 5.5 turn, medium sized scenario that has lots of movement for both sides and portrays one of the Free French Army’s greatest victories in the ETO.

boardgame.name: Quad Play: [4]Deck
boardgame.description:
A non-traditional playing card deck based on The Quad Play game system.

Includes 40 cards. No fixed suits. Card are arranged in two dimensions and divided in two sides, so that suits can be set dynamically. Cards have positive, negative or zero value. The deck balance is 0.

The basic game ("Draw" or "Dr[4]w") rules:
Each card (quad) has 4 pieces (qarts) in one colour (dark or light). These ones define the quad's cost in pts. Dark (purple) qarts have non-negative costs and vice-versa. Center purple qart gives 4 pts as all four hearts intersect each other here. Triangular qart so gives 2 pts and outer one (leaf) means 0. For example, The Good Sign (a quad with 4 purple qarts in shape of full heart) costs 8 pts in total. Players (2 by default) pick 4 quads in a turn. The summary quads' cost in each hand multiplies by 10 (multiplier from 4 to 40). Other number quads to pick is possible (with an appropriate multiplier). The number of turns is conventional (1 by default). The leader in pts wins.
Actually, many traditional card games can also be played with the Quad Deck. The new game logic brings a new experience into a regular game-play.

[4] The Good Sign is first of all... [4]

—user summary

boardgame.name: På tur i Villmarka med Lars Monsen
boardgame.description:
Conquer the Norwegian wilderness with wilderness expert Lars Monsen. Walk, ski, kayak, bike or use dog sled from region to region. Read the map and plan your journey to ensure you outrace your competitors.

Each player is given four cards representing different types of transportation. From each location, only a few transportation options are available, so the players must plan their journey to fit their available transporation cards. After each turn, they draw cards to replace the cards they spent, so that they always start with a hand of four cards.

There are three types of locations on the map: Destinations, where you stop to pick up a location tag for your backpack. Events, where you stop to get wilderness advise from the expert - depending on which option you choose, you can get ahead, fall behind, or help or hinder your opponent. And finally, Minor locations, where you can just pass through without stopping.

To win, you have to be the first player to get a location tag from all five regions, and collect three event cards with a different animal on the back.

boardgame.name: Adventure Master (Issue 5 - Dec 1987/ Jan 1988)
boardgame.description:
MERS scenario, new weapons
DSA talents
rules for solo adventures based on Terry Brooks' Sword of Shannara trilogy

boardgame.name: D-Start
boardgame.description:
From the publisher :
Experience the first fully ready-to-play RPG in an hour. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced role player, D-Start lets players embark on a thrilling adventure right out of the box! The 10 scenarios offered allow you to emerge into various universes among the most renowned in pop culture.

With instant play and quick play, D-Start is an inimitable game that is the perfect introduction to role-playing mechanics, while offering to extend the experience by creating your own characters and adventures!

boardgame.name: Adventure Master (Issue 6 - Feb/Mar 1988)
boardgame.description:
scenario hooks (system agnostic),
Shannara solo adventure part 2

boardgame.name: HOW WE KNOW WE'RE ALIVE
boardgame.description:
HOW WE KNOW WE'RE ALIVE is a free hour long melancholy,
point-and-click narrative mystery set in the bible belt of Sweden.

Welcome to Härunga small industrial town in the bible belt of the mid-north of Sweden. You play as Sara, an aspiring
writer who, after having been away for 10 years, returns home in order to investigate the tragic fate of her estranged best friend.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Three Musketeers
boardgame.description:
The Three Musketeers was a 1987 video game for Commodore 64, developed by American Action. The music in the game was made by Lars Hård from Greve Graphics.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Three_Musketeers_%281987_video_game%29 The Three Musketeers (1987 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Holiday Hijinks #2: The Independence Incident
The Independence Incident
boardgame.description:
We've been tracking a group calling themselves the Culper Ring who believes there are elaborate clues in American historical sites leading to a great treasure.

The Independence Incident, title #2 in the Holiday Hijinks line, is an escape room style game in just 18 cards! As a group, you will solve a series of puzzles to unravel a mystery.

When you have solved a puzzle, you will enter the answer into the companion web app (compatible with all smart phones and computers) and it will check whether you are correct. If you are, the app will tell you which card or cards to take next.

The app also contains a graduated hint system, so if you get stuck you can get just a small hint about the current puzzle to get moving again without giving too much away.

Puzzles may test your perception, wordplay, and lateral thinking. English language fluency is required. Knowledge of traditional American national symbols is helpful, but that information is also provided in the app if you need it.

Most groups take about an hour to solve the game. You can write on the cards to help solve puzzles, but this is not required (or you could use penny sleeves) and the game is otherwise non-destructable. So while you can't play again yourself, you could give the used game to someone else to play.

boardgame.description:
User Summary

Eco is a life simulation with vector graphics.

boardgame.name: EXIT Challenge: Berlin Underground
boardgame.description:
Deep underneath Berlin there is a secret hacker group Berlin Underground. They fight fraud on the internet. You would like to join but nobody knows how to get in touch with them. One day you find yourselves in a locked prison cell. Is this going to be a test by Berlin Underground?

—description from the box (translated)

boardgame.name: 80': the Eightieth Minute
boardgame.description:
A solo soccer storytelling game.

Experience the last minutes of the last match of a grueling soccer campaign, the glory or the heartbreak of an all-or-nothing result. Ten minutes plus stoppage time remain. All still to play for.

It is the 80th minute . . .

To play you will need:

10 to 20 minutes
two 6-sided dice
a standard 52 card deck
a 20-sided die (or pen and paper)
some way to narrate the events as they unfold on the pitch


Flip a card representing a minute of time and roll to see if your team has the grit to weather the late pressure, if the referee is going to add more time.

Narrate the play on the field (for a radio, blog, or newspaper audience) based on prompts tied to each card.

If the last card is discarded before a goal is conceded, your team wins the title (or avoids relegation, or qualifies for the World Cup)!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Moonrakers: Armory & Dispatch Mats
boardgame.description: Two custom neoprene mats for the Dispatch and Armory boards turn any table into the perfect gaming surface.

boardgame.name: Logistix
boardgame.description:
Logistix is about combining logistics and logic. In a large container terminal, as the leader of a forklift crew, you have to make sure that the right containers get onto your ship. Each ship must be loaded according to a certain loading plan and following certain rules, so that the unloading of the cargo at the destination port runs efficiently. As if that wasn't enough, the shipping company has given you special assignments for loading. The player who manages, with skill and a good portion of brainpower, to get into position for the right containers, load them onto the ship according to the rules and fulfil the shipping company's orders, collects the most points and wins the game.

In each round of Logistix you will go through two phases. In the first, each of you bids on the slots that contain your desired containers. You will have to use a lot of skill, maybe even bluffing, to get the right containers. Once you've got the containers, you'll have to solve the loading puzzle on your ship, keeping in mind the shipping company's assignments.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Poppy Field
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Poppies are commonly seen on open spaces on Mayfield, creating patches of a vibrant and characteristic red.

This Mausritter, third-party supplement, was created for the #MoreMausritterMay Mayfield Game Jam.

Be brave and use this poppy objects wisely!

boardgame.name: Venus Flytraps
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Carnivorous plants gain most of their nutrients by ingesting the flesh of living creatures or insects. Do not let their gorgeous flowers lure you in... it will be the last thing you see.

This Mausritter, third-party supplement, was created for the #MoreMausritterMay Mayfield Game Jam.

Botanists beware.

boardgame.name: Thistle's Bite
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Made from the stout and shard leaf of the Milk Thistle, this magical sword is of the most sought out artifacts of Mayfield.

This Mausritter, third-party supplement, was created for the #MoreMausritterMay Mayfield Game Jam.

Be brave and wield this weed!

boardgame.name: Praying Mantis
boardgame.description:

Wise sage insects, these fierce warriors are formidable opponents but also could be valuable allies.

This Mausritter, third-party supplement, was created for the #MoreMausritterMay Mayfield Game Jam.

Tread their grounds wisely...

Bumblebees are fun and cute little bugs, what mouse adventurer wouldn't want one as a companion.

This Mausritter, third-party supplement, was created for the #MoreMausritterMay Mayfield Game Jam.

Hope you have fun with your fuzzy friend.
