boardgame.name: 2020: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
A game designed for those that wish to leave 2020 behind! Create your circle of friends to help you survive the financial hardships of 2020. Do whatever it takes to survive this year above the rest but remember: Problematic players lose their jobs, sponsorships, friends and sometimes even money.

In 2020: The Board Game, players will use their turns to acquire friends, earn income, and avoid the harrowing pitfalls of the real-life disaster that was the year 2020. On each turn, the player will roll the dice, and move their piece the corresponding number of spaces. They then draw and resolve a Social Media card that will present them with a unique real world event that happened in 2020. After drawing the card, players then must resolve the space they've landed on, which may mean acquiring a new friend to help you through the game, or gaining money and/or paying off debt they've accrued.

Players gain survival points based on the cards that they play, and when a player has acquired ten survival points, the end of the game is triggered. At the end of that round, players count their money and the player with the most money wins.

2020: The Board Game provides players with a chance to look back and laugh at the monstrosity of 2020.

—description from the designer

listing.notes: If you'd like to get a copy of the game and you're international or at a discounted rate go to the official website https://2020boardgame.co DM me if your country isn't open, I can open it for you!

boardgame.name: Robotech Macross Dog Fight: The Miniatures Game
boardgame.description:
A gigantic spaceship crash lands on Earth, foreshadowing the arrival of an alien armada bent on war and destruction. The world unites to unlock the secrets of its miraculous alien technology known as Robotech to defend the world against impending invasion. The challenges they would face would be greater than anyone could have imagined...

Tailor a combination of talented pilots and powerful mechs. Outmanoeuvre your opponents and finish them with the right weapons. Survive until the end and claim your victory.

The game plays over multiple rounds. Each round consists of four phases in order.

Planning - Plan your movement secretly.
Movement - Move according to the plan
Cross Event - Initiate a quick battle when mechs cross paths.
Combat - Shoot your opponent down!


The game ends when only one player or one team has mechs remaining in the battlefield. The survivor is declared the winner. If the last mechs of each player is eliminated in the same phase, the player with lower total pilot and mech costs wins. If the totals are equal, the game ends in a tie.

boardgame.name: Family Frakass
boardgame.description:
Familiy Frakass is a Beat them up board game.
It’s a 1 to 3 players cooperative boardgame based on the main characteristic than Beat them up game: Hit, Strike, Weapons, Combo, Henchmen, Boss...
The objective is quite simple, clean the board of each scene of the stage to reach the Boss. Beat it and continue on the next stage.

Each player will have a character with their own specificities.
Then the game will switch between 2 phases: The Player turn and the Game turn.
During the Player turn, the player will use up to 3 action points to make his character moves, strikes or one of the 10 actions available for him.
The only main rules to follow there is: “A player cannot do the same action twice in the row during his turn.” (Means, you can Move, Strike and Move, but you cannot Move, Move, and Strike.)
Then when players finish their turn, the Game turn will start and the game will move by itself following 5 main actions. Those actions are also link to the action
Then it will be to the player turn again.

Regarding the Strike part, player will use colors cards common to all players. Each Heroes character have his own combos. A combo is a specific combination of colors. Means you will have to choose between use your cards of save it to prepare the combo.
You can now add Weapons, Group combo, Character posture and lots of mechanism for more fun and strike! (^_^)

If I try to explains this game by “mechanism”, I would say that an Action evolutive Puzzle, because the situation will change at every Game turn depending of the action done by player(s).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tomb Cat
boardgame.description:
Team Cherry's (late) entry for the Indie Speedrun. Our theme was 'wealth' and our element was 'mummy'. We ending up taking extra time and missed out on the comp, but 72 hours later, here is Tomb Cat! Run and jump through tombs that get trickier as you progress, and make some money to support your kittens!

Keep practising and shoot for the high scores!!!!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Natsuki Chronicles
boardgame.description:
https://ginga-force.fandom.com/wiki/Natsuki_Chronicles

Natsuki Chronicles (ナツキクロニクル Natsuki Kuronikuru) is a shoot'em up game developed by Qute Corporation in 2015 and finally released on December 25th, 2019 on the XBOX One after a 4-year delay on its development. It is a prequel and in-betweener of Ginga Force as the game events take place from before to during those of Ginga Force.

The game takes place 3 years before the boss battle with Natsuki Sugiura and the Garm in Ginga Force. Starting from Natsuki's first mission with the RDF as the new rookie in the team up to the confrontation with Alex and Margaret, now seen from Natsuki's point of view. After her defeat, she realizes the truth of Magni Company, the MSS and the RDF and makes a decision of going against them in order to save Seven Tier.

boardgame.name: The Climb 2
boardgame.description:
From the Oculus store page - https://www.oculus.com/climb-2/

The thrill of climbing comes alive with The Climb 2 - explore a new city setting and exhilarating new maps with breathtaking views. Ascend grand peaks, navigate vast caves, climb skyscrapers, and discover hidden shortcuts as you find your path to the top. Compete with friends and conquer leaderboards in asynchronous multiplayer modes. From exploring mountain environments to scaling urban settings, feel the rush of climbing without ropes, and experience breathtaking vistas as you scale new heights.

boardgame.name: Math Batt: Mathematical Battle
boardgame.description:
Math-Batt (Mathematical Battle) is a card game that teaches times tables to children in an explosion of excitement, bold colours, and adorable cartoon characters. Get the numbers on your side and win the war of multiplication! The fun starts with two or more players. The deck contains 90 cards, divided evenly. On each card you'll find one multiplication equation. To "battle" each player reveals the top card of their stack. The player with the highest equation result wins. For instance, 2 x 2 = 4 defeats 2 x 1 = 2. The winner takes all the cards played in the round. Sometimes battles result in a "draw" where players end up with the same number. When this happens the two must duel in a "war". Players take two cards from their hand, placing one face down and the next face up. Whoever has the higher face-up card wins the war, and takes the other players' pair of cards. Players who run out of cards during the war immediately lose. The game continues until only one player emerges victorious with all 90 cards!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arium: Discover
boardgame.description:
From Publisher's Website:

Arium is the name of our tabletop roleplaying game! Why? We wanted a simple name for a container of possibility.

Think of it like this: an Arium is an overarching world, universe, setting, and story/adventure seeds containing a collection of fascinating landmarks, people, and items!

Arium: Discover will work with any world. Take your favorite TV series, your homebrew setting, or a movie/novel and quickly adapt to run it with Discover. Even better, build an Arium together using Arium: Create as a basis for your game. Arium: Discover builds on your universe by letting players take ownership of characters, items, and locations.

Then, it’s off to tell the story! Adventure, horror, and comedy are all on the table. Sci-fi, fantasy, and intrigue also possibilities! The streamlined d6-based system will feel familiar yet flexible. Additionally, the system of Boons and Banes encourages play that explores the important and meaningful by focusing on the relevant thematic elements of your Arium.

boardgame.name: Sixit
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Sixit is a platform puzzle game.

boardgame.name: Binary Dash
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Binary Dash is a side scrolling platform game. The screen is divided and when the player is at the upper part the character is upright, but on the lower part of the screen the character is up side down. The game have 94 levels.

boardgame.name: Winter War 1939: A Solo Game
boardgame.description:
Winter War 1939: A Solo Game

A solo game where you command a platoon of Finnish infantry trying to stop waves of Russian attackers.
The Russians will still keep on coming until they eventually win.
The object of the game is to see how many waves of attackers you stop.

A simple to play game with lots of variety to keep the game different each time you play.

Turn Sequence:
1- Activate Russian troops
2- Activate Finnish troops
3- Roll for random events

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Shutterbug
boardgame.description:
When you look at the world through a lens, you see things differently. Tiny moments of beauty, otherwise unnoticed until you find them in a single frame. Whether it’s to display your art or to capture precious memories, the camera flash accompanies you wherever you go.

The Shutterbug is a new Kid Type for Animon Story released in celebration of New Pokémon Snap. It is much more specific than any other Kid Type, focusing on a particular hobby that finds its way into every part of the Kid’s life.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Animon Story
boardgame.description:
The Tabletop RPG about Kids and their Monster Friends!
Jump into the world of Animon with this original tabletop roleplaying game inspired by beloved anime and video games. You'll take on the role of Kids who team up with their very own monster buddies called Animon. Together you'll go on adventures, grow as friends, and maybe even save the world!

This book contains everything you need to create unique characters and tell your own stories, with rules designed to encourage and support your creativity.

Featuring:

Fun and easy to learn mechanics using six-sided dice.
Flexible character creation for both Kids and Animon.
Character growth focused on dynamic bonds of friendship between Kids and Animon.
Rules for unlocking powerful new forms through Animon Evolution, from FLEDGLING all the way to GIGA.
Helpful guides for creating unique settings, adventures, and campaigns.
Over 50 NPC friends and foes with simple rules for creating new ones.


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Disney It's a Small World Game
boardgame.description: It’s the happiest cruise that ever sailed! Celebrate the classic Disney attraction, “it’s a small world,” in this playful journey! Discover the joyful children and whimsical animals of the world. Collect colorful picture cards by spotting scenes that can be seen from your little boat. Can you collect the most cards before the end of the day?

boardgame.name: PHOTON: A Module for LIGHT
boardgame.description:
Fiction First Moves for LIGHT in the vein of Powered by the Apocalypse Moves. A guidebook to Element use for different actions for players and GMs new to LIGHT. Hopefully doing this while providing a little more flavor for your games.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: In Extremis
boardgame.description:
In Extremis is a tabletop roleplaying game designed for 2-6 players, about fighting back the man using necromancy, that uses the LUMEN system by Spencer Campbell. Inspired by The Locked Tomb trilogy, players take on the role of exceptionally powerful witches who use their mastery of life, death, and the human condition to keep them and their own safe from other planetary invaders who want to steal their land.

As a Necromancer, you are one of a handful of hideously powerful death witches that protect the planet Hecate, the final holdout for The Coven, from the ever encroaching holy war of the Corvus Dominion. Seeking both answers for why the Necromancers use this heretical magic, and seeking minerals from the core of Hecate; the Corvus Dominion will stop at nothing to destroy these witches.

The Full Game contains:

More rules including the use of powerful Banes that massively shift combat, social abilities, and options for leveling to make you and your Spells more powerful.
50+ Pages of beautiful art, and killer layout
18 Enemy Types
9 Character Classes
Even more fucking Lore


Content Warnings
The book contains a fair deal of body horror, talk of death, and depictions of warfare. Nothing I don't believe you wouldn't expect from a game about necromancy, but be aware going in that those are all in there!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Code Shifter
boardgame.description: In Code Shifter, you play role of Stella, a game developer at the “Awesome Rainbow Corp” who is tasked with squashing the remaining bugs on the eve of the company’s biggest game release. As she scrambles to fix the game, mysterious errors in the program suddenly appear and time is running out to finish the game in time! To deal with the situation, Stella, whips up a debug program: “Code Shifter”, that allows her digital avatar “Sera” to eradicate the issues from within. Along the way, she’ll encounter powerful bugs and anomalies but she’ll get some help from some unexpected allies each with their own special powers. Will Stella and her coworkers be able to find the origin of these bugs and deliver the game before the launch date?

boardgame.name: Disney Mad Tea Party
boardgame.description: Join your favorite friends from Disney’s Alice in Wonderland in this topsy-turvy teacup-stacking game! Play a card to place a teacup, but don’t let the tilting tower fall! Each card tells you which teacup to stack, or adds a fun twist to the tea party. The Mad Hatter may give you a tip, or he may tip the table. Maybe the Cheshire Cat will help you stay on top. Look out for the White Rabbit! Be the first to play all your cards to win. See how tall the tea party gets in this wild Wonderland game!

boardgame.name: Disney You Can Fly!
boardgame.description: Choose one of four Disney character flyers — Dumbo, Buzz Lightyear, Pegasus, or Tinker Bell. Then soar through the sky, among the stars, to infinity and beyond in this imagination-fueled adventure! Create your own course through the house or outdoors and face funny flying challenges — throw with your eyes closed, between your legs, and more! Land your flyer the closest to the clouds and collect the most points to win!
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Disney You Can Fly!

boardgame.name: Disney Hidden Mickeys
boardgame.description:
The out-of-your-seat game with two ways to find Mickey! Play hide and seek with the colorful Mickey Markers, plus look for Hidden Mickeys on the cards! Two clever activities in one fun-filled game! On your turn, flip over a card from the pile. If you flip a Mickey card, one player hurries to find the matching

Hidden Mickey Marker in the house or yard! Bring it back in time to score a card! Once all the Mickey Markers have been found, search for Hidden Mickeys on your reward cards! Find the most Mickeys to win!

boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

An adventure/setting book for Monkey the Roleplaying Game. The Mandate is the most ambitious release that I’ve ever done for Monkey, and is often called the Mega Monkey!

boardgame.name: Duck Trooper
boardgame.description:
The Epic Battle for Survival Between Humans and Invading Ducks from Another Dimension
- cover of book

Duck Trooper is the third game in Tri-Tac's Duck Wars series, following the board games Polywumpus and Pterraductyl (later renamed Pterroductyl). In 2001, the three games were sold together as a PDF compilation titled Duck Wars.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Brian Boru: Haut Roi d'Irlande
Brian Boru: High King of Ireland
Brian Boru: Hochkönig von Irland
Brian Boru: Le Grand Roi d'Irlande
브리안 보루: 아일랜드 통일 전쟁
boardgame.description:
In Brian Boru: High King of Ireland, you strive to unite Ireland under your domain, securing control through might, cunning, and matrimony. Join forces to fend off Viking invaders, build monasteries to extend your influence, and gather support in towns and villages throughout the land. To become High King of all Ireland, you need to navigate a web of shifting alliances, outmaneuver your enemies, and grab history by the reins.

The success of the historical Brian Boru rested on three pillars: his victories against the Vikings, the favor he managed to garner with the Church, and the alliances he forged through political marriages. This became the foundation of the game, with each pillar becoming a suit in the trick-taking that forms the core of the mechanisms. Win a trick and you gain influence in a town, which, in turn, gains you majorities in the regions; if you lose the trick, however (deliberately or otherwise), you instead take an action corresponding to the suit of the card.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Golden Geek Medium Game of the Year Nominee
2021 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Delenda Roma
boardgame.description:
It's the end of the Roman Empire: barbarians at the gates, rebels inside the empire, fighting in the senate.
Will you be able to avoid fate, or will Rome be destroyed?

Delenda Roma is a single player board game when you try to stop the inevitability of the history.

At the start of the game player get a limited amount of gold and armies to be placed on roman provinces, then gameplay is divided in phases:


Event phase: from a deck of cards a new challenge is revealed ( like for example new barbarian invading from outside of the empire or a rebellion on the roman provinces).
Battle phase: for provinces with enemy armies a deterministic fight occurs
Upkeep phase: determine for provinces who is in control and apply consequences
Enemy phase: every enemy units move according to their type
Player phase: player can spend gold to move armies (by land and sea), recruit new armies, placate rebels or bribe the senate
Senate phase: from another deck of cards a senate card is revealed and player has limited turns to fulfil the mission


Player lose when barbarian or rebels take control of Roma and win if they can survive at least 20 turns.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Das Zehnkampfspiel
boardgame.description:
The players roll a die and move around the game board while competing in the 10 decathlon disciplines. They may accept the result of the space they land on or choose to roll again to achive a better result, thereby risking a fail by overshooting the last space of this discipline. If this is the case they have to complete this discipline in another trip around the board. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

When the first player completes all 10 disciplines the game ends and the player who scored the most points wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Die Posträuber
boardgame.description:
The players, as the police, try to catch the main train robber, which is secretly determined by the robber-players and find the bag of loot by moving policemen around the game map and collecting hints. Movement is determined by a die.

The players form two teams: the police and the robbers. Any player may move any figure of hie own team. The robber team decides in secret which robber is the main culprit and which bag contains the loot. From this information they create a secret password from the main feature of the main culprit and the letter of the bag with the loot, for example Moon Boot (Monocle + B 001). The card with the number of the loot bag is removed from the stack and the stach is placed front down on it's space on the game board. The robbers and the bags (front down) are placed on the railway bridge and the police officers at police headquarters.

The robbers try to reach a hideaway (circular blue spaces), which can't be entered by a policeman. If a robber reaches a hideaway the player takes a bag from the bridge and places it inside the hideaway. The police have half an hour to find the main culprit and the bag with the loot. They try to reach the railway bridge while there are still some robbers and bags.

If a policeman gets to the railway bridge, he may turn over all the bags still there and takes all robbers still at at bridge to the prison to interrogate them.

If a figure gets on an orange space, the player takes the upper card from the stack and follows the instructions printed there, depending if he is a policeman or a robber. Some cards contain information for the police about empty bags.

The policemen take robbers into prison to interrogate them, if they land on a space occupied by a robber. During the first interrogation the robber has to tell the password. In further interrogations the police asks about the features of the main culprit (main feature, clothes, tie, ...). The robber has to answer truthfully wit "yes" or "no". Additionally the policeman may turn over any bag and ask, if this bag contains the loot.

The police wins, if they discover who is the main culprit and which bag contains the money inside half an hour. If not, the robbers win. The robbers win also if all get into hideaways, where they are safe from the police.

boardgame.name: Fishing Boats (fan expansion to Carcassonne)
boardgame.description:
The rivers around Carcassonne provide a bounty of fish. Although some of the anglers prefer to fish
from the shores of the rivers, there are others who will take a small boat out to the middle of the
river to fish. Fishing boats can be used like Wagons for the roads.

boardgame.name: Die Schotterbande
boardgame.description:
Die Schotterbande, a co-operative board game for children from 6 to 10, teaches the handling of money in a playful and realistic way, and this is the story behind the game:

A group of friends overhears a secret conversation. Villains want to steal all the money in town! The children want to prevent this at all costs. In just 10 days, they must become superheroes to protect the city's money bunker.

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #28 - Apr 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 80 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues (info on submitting is found inside each issue).

Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #28:

Bexim's Bazaar Pages

Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month

The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks

Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors

Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month

Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost

Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month

Plovin's Rare Documents - each month, a new eldritchd document prop to print for players

Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC

Deed - new printable prop each month related to owning property

Bexim's Bulletin Board 1 - printable prop

Bexim's Bulletin Board 2 - printable prop

The Skirmish Table Pages

Hazel’s Weapons Emporium - Seller of the best (unofficial) weapons and accessories for Gaslands

Relicblade Scenario - The Haunter

Frostgrave Scenario - Prey

Frank's Orbital Garage - Monthly Ship File

Drowned Earth Scenario - Phase 4

CORE SPACE - New Trader Card

GM Resources Pages

Spell Discussion 2 - Fireball

A Swift Survey - A 5e mini-adventure and hand-made map from Bryan Swift

Adventure a Week - a fantasy RPG mini adventure

Kev’s Lounge Paper Miniatures - two paper miniatures to print and make for your game

The Crafting Table Pages

Mines of the Mountain King - Papercraft project from Fat Dragon Games

Incorrigible IMPS - monthy comic strip

boardgame.name: The Evolutionary Mishap
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When an explosion in a nearby section of the laboratory sends you and several other animal test subjects through an interdimensional wormhole, you suddenly find yourselves transformed into highly trained humanoids capable of speech and complex thought. You and your fellow lab animals now find yourselves in an alternate version of feudal Japan and in the middle of war. Even worse, your existence in this alternate dimension seems temporary and your very lives depend on returning to the world from whence you came—but how?

For use with your favorite mutated animal martial arts RPG system

boardgame.name: Out of the Void
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Face the threats of the darkest wilds in this one shot module for the world’s greatest roleplaying game!

"They came from beneath like daemons rising from the depths of Hell! We did not stand a chance."

This one-shot adventure for 4 - 6 PCs of level 5 - 10 takes players on a quest to investigate the appearance of giant chasms, which are swallowing up land and buildings in Pikewater Port and the surrounding area, and to banish the creatures that emerge from within.

There are two Key Events and a Main Event which triggers the final part of the quest. Use the random events to build the story and whenever you are ready, trigger the key and main events and get on with the boss fight!

The module works well as a dark mystery where a sense of foreboding lays like a thick fog over the residents of Pikewater Port and players can feel a creeping sense of dread whenever night falls, and the risk of an attack is ever present!

boardgame.name: ICON (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are your players tired and hungry after saving the galaxy for the second time this week? Reward them with a trip to ICON!

Tangible Taverns: ICON details a chain of satellite-based fast food restaurants that can easily be inserted into your campaign. Is the party spending more time planet-side than plying the space lanes? No problem, there seems to be an ICON Express in every settlement!

This PDF includes rumour and event tables, two maps, and descriptions of the staff and a few patrons of the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities, art, and stat blocks).

Sit back, dip your fries into your milkshake, and add a little role-playing to the evening with this Tangible Tavern.

boardgame.name: Faith for Fools
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Faith for Fools, a group of level-4 adventurers visits the locally popular Church of the Seven Blossoms, a sub-sect of the great religion of the Sun God. The person in charge, Mother Superior Elvira, is famous for her determination to increase the influence and power of her sisterhood. However, something has gone terribly wrong at the church and it is all the fault of the Mother Superior. She dabbled in ancient secrets and forbidden books and got herself and the sisterhood tangled in a regrettable tragedy.

The adventurers come in time to clean this mess and save many people from a terrible fate. However, much of the damage has already been done; the future of the Church of the Seven Blossoms is grim...

Explore fantasy worlds and immersive adventures!

boardgame.name: Raven of the Scythe Companion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Raven of the Scythe Companion adds many new rules and elements to the Raven of the Scythe Fantasy Role Playing Game for both players and GMs.

The Companion Includes

Rules for Fantasy Races

Mutations

New Equipment

New Skills

New Favors

Rules for Creating Towns and Cities

Rules for Downtime Activities

Rules for War and Mass Combat

Rules for Ships, navigating, and trading on the high seas.
boardgame.rpg: Raven of the Scythe Fantasy Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Tiana's Ensorcelled Sorrow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 4-6 characters of level 2

Some ruins bewilder, others inspire awe, but for Tiana they just cause sorrow.

On her last day alive she witnessed the walls of her home crumble, her father buried. Men and women set to protect her home bled out around her. Vernye, her loving dog, was buried beneath debris. Then: the red gleam of her blood on a blade.

The recently established village of Khorol lies close to the site of this tragedy and the new residents quickly discovered the haunting. Yet, trade with the north was the sole reason for settling here, travel at night unavoidable—a small bridge was set in place, everyone hoping for the best.

A vicious storm befalls the party on the anniversary of the massacre, just as they stumble into the small village looking for shelter. What they discover is panic. A lone trader, bleeding and close to death, tells of the bridge being washed out and mentions two children trapped on the ruins’ side, sheltered inside by a panicked guard. The locals agree that the kids are doomed. Galyna, the town’s matron, begs the party to attempt a rescue, offering a reward alongside free room and board for a week.

boardgame.name: Lair of the Goblin King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Azlac, the Goblin King that has united several scattered goblin tribes in the area, has been wreaking havoc on the local towns and roads. Can the players infiltrate his lair and end the goblin raids once and for all? In addition to some new Goblin baddies to throw at your players - including a goblin-harpy crossbreed - Azlac also has two powerful magical weapons at his disposal. The players will need their wits, brawn, and possibly some unlikely allies they meet along the way if they are to survive.

There are some great low-level goblin adventures out there. Lair of the Goblin King, a 4th level adventure for 5e, is meant to be used at the final "boss battle" adventure to complete a low level goblin ark for your campaign.

12 Page 5e Adventure for a 4th level party
3 Original Monsters with artwork and VTT Tokens
2 New Magic Items
4 High Resolution battlemap variants of the Goblin Lair ideal for VTT
12 Hexplorer Map Tiles to create a regional area for hex-crawl campaigns
Plug-and-play design to make dropping the adventure into your campaign as easy as possible with minimal prep

boardgame.name: The Fey'ri
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Fey'ri are planetouched Elves similar to Tieflings, who bred with demons long ago and forged a corrupt dynasty. No longer considered elves, they draw power from their demonic bloodlines and carve a place out in the world for themselves.

boardgame.name: Hanyou
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hanyou are half-breeds born from yokai, fiends who originate from the shadowfell and feed upon the negative karma of mortal beings. Hanyou live cursed lives, inheriting aspects of their parents. Some may be born fortunate and retain the beauty and grace of their parents, and others may be deformed and grotesque. The life of a Hanyou is one between worlds, never knowing one's place.

The Hanyou is modular race that has customizable positive and negative traits, based on their varied lineage.

boardgame.name: Heaven's Sent
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So much time has passed since the sylphs flew across the heavens, hanging the stars in the firmament and shepherding the clouds, that many believed them an extinct people. For those who know where to look, though, contradictory evidence is widespread: ancient cities hidden in high mountains; dark specks drifting high in the air, pinned to the sky by magic long lost; sightings of flying people; and sudden tempests in whose black clouds armed and armored warriors hurl lightning at the ground. The sylphs might have left the troubles of Rûl behind, but they have never been far away.

Heaven’s Sent explores the sylphs presented in the Demon Lord’s Companion 2, offering new options for character creation, clarification of the ancestry rules, and new paths. Armed with this supplement, you can create compelling sylph characters to fight the minions of the Demon Lord and safeguard creation from its myriad enemies. The genies entrusted the sylphs with the heavens; now is your chance to preserve reality from utter, apocalyptic ruin.

boardgame.name: Ghostly Hauntings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the ghosts in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Number Drop
boardgame.description:
Number Drop is a Tetris style roll & write game played with shapes & numbers.

Players use 4 number dice and 1 shape die to determine the way they must fill in their grid, by creating the shape with the numbers. Players also have 5 block tiles they can use to block the other players' grid.

In this game, you must drop shapes in the right places to create combinations of identical or consecutive numbers on your grid. You aim at being the most efficient and being able drop penalties onto your opponents !
As soon as a player reaches the Game Over line, the game ends and whoever has the most points is the winner.

Will you reach the ultimate score of 100 ?

boardgame.name: The Wyvern case
The Wyvern job
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Word spreads quickly that the Count has abandoned
his castle to the clutches of a Wyvern.
For you, that means an unattended vault room and
a race to get there before the others!


La nouvelle se répand rapidement : le Compte a abandonné son château aux griffes d'une Wyvern.
Pour vous, cela veut dire une salle des coffres sans surveillance
et une course pour y arriver avant les autres !
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Le casse de la Wyvern PDF

boardgame.name: Hidden Depths
boardgame.description:
A 24 hour RPG Supers adventure using the Fate Core System and Venture City Sourcebook.

The team is summoned to the lab of one, Dr. Aaron Bruce, a noteworthy robotics researcher at Capitol City University and outspoken CEO of Cybertek. Upon arriving, the team is informed that Dr. Bruce is missing, and assumed kidnapped, based on the state of his lab, which has been destroyed.

boardgame.name: Summer Camp
boardgame.description:
Find your cabin assignment, wring out your swimsuit, and relive the days of canoeing, friendship bracelets, and s'mores with Summer Camp, a competitive deck-building game in which players race to earn merit badges and collect the most experience points to win. Each player has their own deck of cards to play, and as the game progresses you add new cards to your deck to make it even stronger.

Summer Camp differs each playing as the game includes seven different merit badge decks along with the base deck: adventure, arts & crafts, cooking, friendship, games, outdoors, and water sports. Each game uses three merit badge decks that can be mixed and matched for unique gameplay scenarios.

To win, players must earn the most camp experience points, points that are gained by claiming merit badges, advancing your pawns along the merit paths, and buying cards. Devise your strategy, build the best card combinations to outplay your opponents, and rule the summer as the ultimate camper!

boardgame.name: Burst Transmissions, vol. 6
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Burst Transmissions is a series of small, suggested modifications (“house rules”) and quick-and-dirty mechanics for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

This volume covers:

Acclimating to Alien Gravity
Determining Height and Weight
Expanding Steward Skill
Enhancing Athletics Skill
Mapping Variant Careers
Powerful Opponents
Quick Backgrounds
Quick NPC Personalities
Usage Dice
Walking the Burst

boardgame.name: Myriad Items & Inventory System
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of managing inventory based on weight? Want to track inventory with a more intuitive system? How about an inventory system that can be used with ANY tabletop RPG in existence?

The Myriad Loot & Inventory System is intended to replace most of the inventory, loot, and general item-related rules in any tabletop RPG, including D&D, Pathfinder, Pythòs, GURPS, FATE, and so on.

Included:

Simple and intuitive inventory system based on item sizes and slots.
Loot Generation guidelines and tips. Best when paired with Myriad Loot Cards.
Loot tables for Fantasy, Modern, and Sci-Fi settings.
Item lists with size, weight, and value.
Stand-alone monetary/value system that assumes characters always have exact change. Don't bother with currency conversions unless it's important to the story.
Character Inventory Sheets (including form fill versions): Generic plus 14 different character variations

boardgame.name: Beatdown at Big Battle Ridge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For use with Tunnels & Trolls (including Deluxe), Monsters! Monsters! and similar works.

This scenario is set in the lands of Hylax the campaign created by the author for her T&T/M!M! players over the past few years. More specifically, it is in the border between the Reservation where the nations of monsters, ill-kin in her dialect, and the dwarven monument Mount Krushmore looming over them. The monument commemorates the final routing of ill-kin opposition to Good Peoples’ expansion over the island at the Big Battle in the mountains, now called Big Battle Ridge, where the work was established. Images of the dwarven generals that defeated the somewhat united monsters was constructed in the mountainous ridge line that stretches along the eastern border of the Rez, as it is colloquially known, and is still being worked on at when the Player-Characters start the role-playing sessions contained in this work.

boardgame.name: Heroes of the Frontier: Brainstormer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

New character options for The Frontier, the shoot-and-loot sci-fic roleplaying game!

The Telepath is already one of the most capable and well-rounded character classes in The Frontier. This accessory adds fourteen new psionic powers for all levels of play to his repertoire. The new powers emphasise the Telepath’s existing talent for telepathy and telekinesis, and add a new sphere of influence: warping reality through the use of illusions.

boardgame.name: DOOM (M&M 3E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Misfits & Menaces DOOM 3e is back in this updated version of our popular supernatural supervillain secret society sourcebook.

DOOM delivers supernatural horror and unrepentant evil to your game. Founded when several ancient dark, mystic secret societies merged, DOOM looks to the insane-inspiring Lost Ones for favor by working black magics and even blacker goals towards ruling (or ending) the world,

Contents include:

Two variations of game stats for DOOM’s flunkies, the cultist, dagger assassins, sorcerers, and half-demon Imps


DOOM’s demonic slaves, the Barzani, and their warlord rulers, the Riders of the Apocalypse, including game statistics for demon hybrids, the basic demon, along with Death, Famine, Pestilence, and War

The Doomsayers, DOOM’s elite metahuman strike force, including their leader, the undying spell-smith Acolyte, and the skinless Bone, triple-headed Cerberus, enigmatic Chain, brutish Deadman and his formless partner, Switch, dark Fallen Angel, fiery Hellfire, turncoat Nether, and duplicitous Speed Demon
Over 30 sample spell builds presented in a way that allows them to easily scale to meet your needs
Caper ideas for each character, as well as DOOM overall, to make incorporating them into your game easier
Over a dozen new creatures, ranging from headhunting immortals to demons to hellhounds to giant insects controlled by Famine.

boardgame.name: Trans-Europe
boardgame.description:
The game is played on a stylized map of Europe with a printed transport network. Players are given a starting location, a destination, and 4 transportation orders to 4 European cities. Players set a driving route and move their pieces across the transportation network. The movement is controlled by a turntable. Depending on the freight, one of the 8 possible directions and speeds of travel can be selected 4 times truck (slow), 2 times freight train (medium) or 2 times freight express train (fast).
In his turn, the player rolls the dice once and must either draw and execute an event card or turn the turntable to the left or right and move his figure accordingly. Cities with transport orders and the destination city must be reached exactly.
The player who arrives first at his destination city wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: V2000
boardgame.description: The follow up to the classic ´80's hit "Virus" (Zarch in North American market) from David Braben.

boardgame.name: Post of Honour: Wargames rules for the War of the Austrian Succession & the Seven Years' War 1740-1763
boardgame.description:
Post of Honour – Wargames rules for the War of the Austrian Succession & the Seven Years War 1740-1763 is designed for a ‘classic’ historical wargame.

Features:

12-20 units per side,
game lasts a couple of hours,
it can be played at home or at your wargaming club.
the overall commander controls 3 to 5 brigades and up to 2 independent units.


The rules were developed for games using 25-30mm figures, and conversion to other scales is easy.

Turn Sequence
Each turn has 5 phases:
1- Initiative. The winner elects to be side A or side B.
2- Movement. Side A moves (generals move last), then side B moves (generals last).
3- Firing. Simultaneous fighting.
4- Close Combat. Simultaneous fighting. Initiative winner chooses order of combats.
5- Generalship & Rallying. Simultaneous. Generalship first, then rally checks.
Morale may need to be checked in the movement, firing, or close combat phases.

—description from the rulebook
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: War of the Austrian Succession

boardgame.name: Enchanters: Deluxe Box
boardgame.description:
Enchanters is all about saving a village from monsters. Shuffle a few Kingdom decks together to create the set of items, enchantments and threats! On your turn, journey to collect a card from these decks, or rest to recover. Stack up equipment and enchantments to become the best battlemage!

In the fantasy card-drafting game Enchanters, you create an artifact and upgrade it each turn. Every card you take retains some of its power. As you grow stronger, you can take on more powerful monsters and, if you plan well, even defeat a dragon.

To set up the game, each player takes five crystals, then you shuffle together as many kingdom decks as the number of players, then lay out six cards (either items of enchantments) on the journey track. In the game, players take turns to embark on quests, collecting cards from the journey track by paying with crystals. Acquired cards are placed into adjacent stacks, with something like “Long Sword” going into the item stack and cards like “of Fire” going into the enchantment stack; combined, these cards create the “Long Sword of Fire”, and cards grant both temporary bonuses (upper icons and skills) and permanent ones (bottom icons).

Included in the Deluxe Box :

Overlords decks: Bandits, Cultists, Unicorns, Gnolls, Goblins, Draco, Barbarians, Faires, Angels, Troglodytes , Undead, Dark Elves, Golems, Mages, Slimes and Demons

Odyssey decks: Centaurs, Gladiators, Harpies, Medusae, Mermaids and Mummies

East Quest: decks Ninjas, Monks, Samurais, Nagas, Pirates and Geishas

Event Deck
Class Deck
Banner Deck
Coop Deck
Mythic Deck
Wound Deck (eshop exclusive)
Quest Deck
all Villages
all Overlords
Banners and classes
Crystal set
Plastic Wound tokens
Shuriken Tokens
Pearl Tokens
Defence and attack plastic tracker tokens
Fate cards for Solo play
Neoprene kit

boardgame.name: Merchants Cove: Backer-built Rogue Pack
boardgame.description:
Originally included in the Kickstarter campaign, these additional Rogue cards were created from backer comments. They haven't been fully playtested and balanced though.

Included are 3 blank cards and 5 new Rogue cards:


Genies
May be placed on Boats during setup.
4 in the Adventurer bag & 4 in the Lair
Effect: When you Dock a Boat containing one or more Rogues, you may move 1 small Good matching a Customer on that Boat from your supply to your Sale Shelf. If you choose not to, all other players draw 1 Corruption card, starting in clockwise order.





Vigilantes
May be placed on Boats during setup.
2 in the Adventurer bag & 6 in the Lair
Effect: When you Dock a Boat containing one or more Rogues, remove 1 Rogue from the Lair and place it into the Adventurer bag.





Revolutionaries
May be placed on Boats during setup.
6 in the Adventurer bag & 0 in the Lair
Effect: During Final Scoring, Corruption is worth positive Gold instead of negative, and Faction Icons are worth negative Gold instead of positive.





Superbackers
May be placed on Boats during setup.
4 in the Adventurer bag & 3 in the Lair
Effect: Increase the base Gold price of all Goods sold at a Dock containing a Rogue by 1. If there are multiple Rogues here, the price increases by 1 for each one present.





Automatons
May be placed on Boats during setup.
5 in the Adventurer bag & 3 in the Lair
Effect: When you Dock a Boat containing one or more Rogues, each player may optionally draw 1 Corruption card to activate any 1 Staff Ability on their Staff board per Rogue on the Boat. If a Boat that Docks contains multiple Rogues, each Staff Ability may be activated once at most, for a total cost of 1 Corruption. These chosen Staff Abilities do not require a hired townsfolk.

boardgame.name: Warpstar! Caldera
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A setting and adventure supplement for use with Warpstar!

Explore Caldera, a planetary system dominated by the Hegemony. Rich in resources, the Warp Consortium tries every method to gain a foothold in the system and exploit the treasures it holds...

Can the character’s help?

This supplement contains:

Part 1: A description of the Caldera system, including rumours, factions and sights for each world.

Part 2: The adventure Midnight Sun, where a mysterious technology is sought by all and the characters are caught in the middle.

Part 3: The adventure Ravager, where the characters get to see first hand the power of the technology they sought in Midnight Sun.

Power struggles, mysteries and danger await in the Caldera system!

boardgame.name: Bold Brigands of the Belt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They’re bold, they’re brigands, and they are in the Belt!

Bold Brigands of the Belt (Classic) is a Rocket Age (Classic) adventure for characters of no more than 13 Story Points, preferably those with a rocket ship, although one can be provided by a patron for the adventure. Rocket ships are being stolen across the Solar System, some taken in deep space, others brazenly (some would say boldly) stolen from rocket ports ranging from Venus to Jupiter. Someone has to stop them, and maybe figure out who these Bold Brigands are and why they are stealing so many ships.

Spoiler alert, that someone is you. Travel to the Red Quadrant of the Asteroid Belt, explore the shifting maze of space rocks, and face the Bold Brigands of the Belt on their home turf in this pulse pounding adventure by Ed Greenwood!
